item.title: Running the Spring Boot application as a Linux system service
item.description: I’m working on a legacy project today. There is a Spring Boot project deployed on a physical server on the customer’s intranet, and recently, for some reason, the server has been rebooting frequently. It’s a pain to manually start the Spring Boot project after each reboot, so I’m going to configure it to turn on a self-starting service. This was done with the help of systemd.
